gurmukhi: doaU Aiq hI Akulwny ] BUK ipAws so qn murJwny ] Arqy lrqy hÍY geI swNJ ] rih gey qwhI rn ky mwNJ ]1659]
transliteration: Dooo At(i) Hiakulaane|| Bhookh Piaas So Tan Murjhaane|| Arte Larte Hvai Gadsaanjh|| Rah(i) Gad Taahiran Ke Maanjh||1659||
translation: Both the armies were extremely agitated and with hunger and thirst, the bodies of the warriors withered; the evening fell with continued fighting and all of them had to remain in the battlefield.1659.

gurmukhi: Bor BXo sB suBt su jwgy ] duh ids mwrU bwjn lwgy ] swjy kvc SsqR kr Dwry ] bhur ju`D ky hyq isDwry ]1660]
transliteration: Bhor Bhayo Sabh Soubhat Su Jaage|| Duh Dis Maroo Baajan Laage|| Saaje Kavach Shastra Kar Dhdare|| Bahur Juddh Ke Het Sidhdare||1660||
translation: In the morning, all the warriors awoke and the battle-drums were played from both the sides; the warriors wearing their armours and holding weapons marched for war.1660.

gurmukhi: iSv kO jm kO riv kO sMg lY bsudyv ko nMd clXo rn DwnI ] mwrn ho Air kY Air ko hir ko hir BwKq XoN muK bwnI ]
transliteration: Shiv Kau Jam Kau Rav(i) Kau San Lai Basudev Ko Nand Chadyo Ran Dhaanee|| Maaran Ho Ar(i) Kai Ar(i) Ko Har(i) Ko Har(i) Bhaakat Yon Moukh Baanee||
translation: Vasudev, the son of Vasudev accompanied by Shiva, Yama and Surya went towards the battlefield and Krishna said to Brahma, “We have to kill the enemy definitely, stabilising ourselves;”

gurmukhi: sXwm ky sMig Gny aumfy Bt pwnn bwm kmwnin qwnI ] Awie iBry KVgyS ky sMg ASMk Bey kCu SMk n mwnI ]1661]
transliteration: Syaam Ke San(i) Ghane Oumde Bhat Paanan Baam Kamaanan(i) Taanee|| Ooe Bhire Khadgesh Ke San Ashank Bhae Kachhu Shank N Maanee||1661||
translation: Many warriors rushed forward in the company of Krishna and holding their bows and arrows, came to fight with Kharag Singh fearlessly.1661.

gurmukhi: gXwrh Gwiel kY iSv ky gn dÍwds sUrin ky rQ kwty ] Gwie kIXo jm ko ibrQI bsu AwTn kau llkwr kY fwty ]
transliteration: Gadrah Ghaail Kai Shiv Ke Gad Dvaadas Sooran(i) Ke Rath Kaate|| Ghaae Keeyo Jam Ko Birthibas(u) Aathan Kau Lalkaar Kai Daate||
translation: The eleven ganas of Shiva were wounded and the chariots of the twelve Suryas were shattered; Yama was wounded and all the eight Vasus were challenged and frightened;

gurmukhi: S`qR ibmuMfq kIny Gny ju rhy rn qy iqn ky pg hwty ] paux smwn Cuty niRp bwn sBY dl bwdl ijau cl PwtY ]1662]
transliteration: Shattra Bimounndat Keene Ghane Ju Rahe Ran Te Tin Ke Pag Haate|| Paoun Samaan Nrip Baan Sabhai Dal Baadal Jio Chal Phaatai||1662||
translation: Many enemies were made headless and those who survived, ran away from the battlefield; the arrows of the king were discharged with the speed of wind and all the forces were torn like clouds.1662.

gurmukhi: Bwj gey rn qy frkY Bt qau iSv eyk aupwie ibcwrXo ] mwtI ko mwns eyk kIXo iqh pRwn pry jb sXwm inhwrXo ]
transliteration: Bhaaj Gad Ran Te Dar-kai Bhat Tau Shiv Ek Oupaae Bichdaryo|| Maatiko Maanas Ek Keeyo Tih Praan Dare Jab Syaam Nihdaryo||
translation: When all ran away from the battlefield, Shiva thought of a remedy; he created a human being of clay, in which the life-force was put by Krishna on seeing it;

gurmukhi: isMG AjIq DirE iqh nwmu dIE br ru`dR mrY nhI mwrXo ] SsqR sMBwr soaU kr mY KVgyS ky mwrn hyq isDwrXo ]1663]
transliteration: Singh Ajeet Dhario Tih Naam(u) Deeo Bar Ruddra Darai Nahimdaryo|| Shastra Sanbhaar Sooo Kar Mai Khadgesh Ke Maaran Het Sidhdaryo||1663||
translation: He was named Ajit Singh, who was also unconquerable before Shiva; he held the weapons and started away in order to kill Kharag Singh.1663.
